byline.original: By CLAIRE A. HILL and RICHARD W. PAINTER

abstract: Two corporate law professors argue that a better way to rein in risky trading by bankers is to hold top executives personally liable for losses if their banks fail.
snippet: Two corporate law professors argue that a better way to rein in risky trading by bankers is to hold top executives personally liable for losses if their banks fail.

headline.main: Another View: A Simpler Rein Than the Volcker Rule
